heading: Today
text: Localized morning rain or snow showers in the north and mountains tapering off.  Morning sun in southern valleys, then increasing afternoon sun south, into the northern valleys.  Windy and colder.  Highs from the low 40s to low 50s north to south.  West winds, shifting to the northwest 10 to 25 mph, gusting 35 to 45 mph.

heading: Tonight
text: Mostly clear south, and clearing north in the evening.  Increasing clouds late.  Lows in the upper 20s and 30s.  Winds northwest 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 25 mph in the evening, diminishing overnight.

heading: Wednesday
text: Any morning sun east giving way to clouds.  A period of rain or snow showers north late morning and early afternoon, then showers likely from the Adirondacks north, spreading east from Rt. 4 north.  Highs ranging through the 40s.  Southwest winds near 10 mph, becoming light, turning to the south near 10 mph in the afternoon.
